subs.desc: Be the first to get all news!

stats.left: members of the gaming and education community

gameLearning.title: How game-based learning enriches overall education?

txt.left: Lessons come alive with different worlds, characters and exercises
txt.middle: Students experience the results of their actions in simulated situations

research.title: Educational benefits for students - based on research

bottomWrapper.title: Teachers can manage lessons easily!
bottomWrapper.sub: We provide what is needed the most

cardLeft.desc: "Three Cubes" consultant helps with the first lessons!

cardMiddle.desc: Plans for lessons, video trainings accessible at any time.

cardRight.desc: Exercises and virtual worlds based on different topics.

community.sub: teachers rate "Three Cubes" educational content for formal education as "good" and "very good"!

slide01.review: The Great School Concept points out adventures in school. Game-based learning is a great method to reach to academic results!

slide02.review: The students are included in practical, creative activities – thus their motivation to learn is getting stronger

slide03.review: These lessons develop children’s competencies, like creativity, technological intuition, critical thinking, abilities to solve problems individually and in teams

cardLeft.desc: In 2020 we won the 1st place in category "Learning and education" in a national competition

cardRight.desc: In 2020 we were selected as one of the 16 best digital solutions in Europe

package.title: "Three Cubes" interactive lessons - a great way to improve not only knowledge, but also competencies!

cardLeft.desc: Interactivity provides possibilities to gain knowledge in various ways

cardMiddle.desc: The attention is directed on improving students' compotencies

cardRight.desc: Lessons's topics chosen to correlate with formal education programs

orderNow.main: US schools are using "First Humans on Mars" course in their formal education!

reviews.title: "Three Cubes" interactive lessons - provide a convenient way to develop not only knowledge but also competencies
reviews.title2: Teacher observations on students' experiences, using "Minecraft" while learning

inter-card.title:
National Education Agency website:
www.mokykla2030.lt states following:
inter-card.desc: "Curriculum update follows the approach launched in the 2008 programs, but the concept of competence itself has been developed and refined. It also seeks to reveal the links between subject content and competences and to illustrate how competencies are developed through subject content"

cardLeft.desc: Developed following updated general education curriculum

cardMiddle.desc: Interactivity provides access to knowledge in a variety of forms

cardRight.desc: Attention is focused on the development of students' competencies

slide01.desc: The shortage of abilieties to work in teams, patience and achieving results really came to light during exercises. The experience of "Three Cubes" lessons are very useful for developing these competencies.

slide02.desc: During these lessons children feel safe – they are not afraid to make a mistake or not know something.

keyBenefits.title: According to a survey, teachers who use "Three Cubes" lessons state that it improves…

mars.title: The First Humans on Mars
mars.sub: Create the first cosmic base on planet Mars!

themes.title: Topics of lessons
themes.theme3: supplying the bases with energy, by using sun and wind power stations;
themes.theme4: learning how to obtain fertilizers and grow food;
themes.theme5: creating new stories, myths and legends for the people generation in Mars;
themes.sub: There is no individual registration for lessons.

gameDesign.title: Game design with "Minecraft"
gameDesign.desc: The kids become the crew of the colony spaceship, solving various tasks together with the ship control robot and thus learning about game design!

sub.text: For individual registration visit "CodeAcademy Kids"

first.desc: Game design and game development basics

third.desc: Applying learned theoretical and practical knowledge by developing a game

marsPackage.title: Organizations that get interactive "Three Cubes" lessons are provided with

ecology.title: Informal education in United Kingdom
ecology.text1: Modules of different themes let children improve knowledge on various topics, e.g. Carbon Monoxide, Climate Change.
ecology.text2: Learn about Carbon Monoxide in a safe virtual environment in "Minecraft" and Climate Change during an interactive expedition in Antarctica!
ecology.text3: Students solve exercises individually and in teams.
ecology.text4: Students and schools in United Kingdom have started these interactive lessons with "Minecraft"

mars.title: Formal education in the United States
mars.text1: The course "First Humans on Mars" can aim to improve knowledge on mathematics, biology, chemistry, geography and astronomy.
mars.text2: The course consist of virtual Mars world and interactive exercises for students.
mars.text3: Students solve exercises individually and collaborating in teams.
mars.text4: Schools in the United States use "Three Cubes" lessons in their formal education.

gigaF.title: TESLA Gigafactory 2 with "Minecraft"
gigaF.text1: "Tesla" has shared the video of the project in it's official "Twitter" account, saying that "Lithuania knows the way to our hearts".
gigaF.text2: During "Gigaton" a team has came up with an idea to build "Tesla Gigafactory 2" in "Minecraft".
gigaF.text3: Students solve exercises individually and collaborating in teams.
gigaF.text4: Students and schools in the United Kingdom use "Three Cubes" lessons with "Minecraft".
gigaF.text5: The video of the project has gained over 260,000 views on "Youtube".

Vilnius.title: Lithuania related projects
Vilnius.text1: We recreated historical Vilnius in 5 different epochs.
Vilnius.text2: We rebuilt one of the most important Vilnius places: Gediminas Castle Tower, The Cathedral Square, National Museum - Palace of the Grand Dukes of Lithuania and the surrounding territory.
Vilnius.text3: "Minecraft" builders consisted of students in schools and universities.
Vilnius.text4: 10 different Vilnius schools have tried out the maps with VR!
Vilnius.text5: The video of the project gained over 40,000 views on "Youtube" platformoje.

3kids.title: Three students
3kids.text1: 3 educational adventures for improving knowledge on Lithuania's history.
3kids.text2: Educational adventure themes: "Rescuing Vytis", "The Teasure of the Dukes" ir "The Act of Independence".
3kids.text3: Some voices of the characters' are recorded by well-known people in Lithuania - Gabrielius Liaudanskas-Svaras and Liudas Mažylis.
3kids.text4: Educational adventures can be downloaded and used for free
3kids.text5: The video of the project has gained over 12,000 views on "Youtube".

gedas.title: Improve Gediminas with "Minecraft"
gedas.text1: Just in 3 days 12 builders of "Three Cubes" have managed to creatively recreate Vilnius territory from 2,300,000 blocks during livestrem.
gedas.text2: Together with telecom organisation "Labas", "Three Cubes" has came up with a project to creatively recreate Gediminas Castle Tower.
gedas.text3: The main architect of building with "Minecraft" was youtuber and "Three Cubes" Co-Founder Darius Kniūkšta.
gedas.text4: The event moderator was Orijus Gasanovas, comedians Mantas Katleris and Mantas Bartuševičius, historian Aurimas Švedas joined the livestream.
gedas.text5: The video of the project has gained over 155,000 views on "Facebook".

news.title: Naujienos
news.cardMain1: Lietuvos mokyklose pamokos pradėjo vykti per "Minecraft".
news.cardMain2:
Kompiuteriniai žaidimai vietoje pamokų?
Idėja laimėjo 20 000 eurų.
news.cardMain3: Lietuviui pomėgis žaisti kompiuterinius žaidimus tapo profesija.
news.cardMain4: Kitas lygis. Tinklalaidė apie žaidimų industriją Lietuvoje.
news.cardAll1: "Trys kubai" pristatymas LR Seime apie mokymąsi su "Minecraft"
news.cardAll2: "Trys kubai" įgytas sertifikatas, atliktus "Minecraft" edukacinės platformos kursus Briuselyje "Microsoft" ofise
news.cardAll5: "Trys kubai" salė su "Minecraft" projektais, turinio kūrėjais ir pristatymais apie "Youtube" renginyje "GameOn 2017"
news.cardAll6: "Trys kubai" stendas su "Minecraft" turnyru, turinio kūrėjais ir diskusijomis renginyje "Comic Con Baltics 2017"
news.cardAll7: "Trys kubai" stendas su "Minecraft" edukaciniais nuotykiais parodoje "Mokykla 2019"
news.cardAll8: "Hour of Code" renginys rengtas kartu su "Microsoft" ir MO muziejumi

hero.sub2: Subscribe to the "Three Cubes" newsletter and receive a self-guided lesson package by e-mail!

king&queen.title: "King Mindaugas & Queen Morta"
king&queen.sub: Students complete tasks cooperatively and learn about the coronation ceremony!
topics: Visits to the library of historical sources and the castle

jan13.title: "January 13th"
jan13.sub: Get acquainted with historical events, the course of the day of January 13

lesson.desc: Critical thinking, social and citizenship competences, respect for human rights and freedoms are developed. Students perform tasks individually and in groups.
topics: Complete tasks at Vilnius TV tower
Reflect on the events with the teacher and share what you learned

ukraine.title: "Humanitarian Aid for Ukraine"
ukraine.sub: Learn how to quickly deliver humanitarian aid to Ukraine through cooperation

lesson.desc: The goal of the lesson is to teach the students how we can support Ukraine by working together.
topics: Learn about different sectors of industry
Work in teams to accomplish tasks

For any questions feel free to contact info@tryskubai.lt
Trys kubai educator could teach your class, this year's price is 3 eur/student, contact tadas@tryskubai.lt, +370 (600) 10 584 for an offer.

downloadForm.title: Lesson download form
downloadForm.instructions: Subscribe to the "Three Cubes" newsletter and receive a self-guided lesson package by e-mail. mail!
notes: The lesson package is designed in a way that the teacher can conduct the lesson for the class on his own.
The lesson package includes: program installation instructions, lesson plan and preparation files, virtual lesson world file.
After subscribing to the newsletter, a gift — a lesson package — will be automatically sent to the specified e-mail.
By downloading the lesson package, you agree that your email address will be registered for statistical and feedback gathering purposes. More about this:
downloadForm.desc: You can choose to receive news about our products and other communications for direct marketing purposes. This is important and is intended for us to be able to contact you - to hear your opinion, how you managed to conduct the lesson on your own and help in case of questions.
downloadForm.gdpr: By downloading lesson you agree that your email will be stored for statistical and feedback collecting purposes.

Select package language

gdpr.title: We value your privacy
gdpr.desc: We use cookies to enhance your browsing experience and analyze our traffic. By clicking "Accept all", you consent to our use of cookies.

info.title: Description
info.lang: This site use this cookie to remember a user's language settings.
info.github: The websites host (GitHub Inc.) loggs and stores your IP address. (their privacy policy).
info.mailer: This site use this cookie to determine if a website visitor has seen newsletter pop-up or not, and whether or not to show the pop-up again according to your behavior settings.
info.ga: The _ga cookie, installed by Google Analytics, calculates visitor, session, and also keeps track of site usage for the site's analytics report. The cookie stores information anonymously and assigns a randomly generated number to recognize unique visitors..
info.gaID: The _ga_container-ID cookie, installed by Google Analytics is used to persist session state.

preference.title: Customize Consent Preferences
preference.desc1: We use cookies to help you navigate efficiently and perform certain functions. You will find detailed information about all cookies under each consent category below.
preference.desc2: The cookies that are categorized as "Necessary" are stored on your browser as they are essential for enabling the basic functionalities of the site

necessary.title: Necessary
necessary.desc: Necessary cookies are required to enable the basic features of this site, such as providing services or saving visitor's language preference. These cookies do not store any personally identifiabl data.

functional.title: Functional
functional.desc: Functional cookie help perform functionality of third-party feature.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.desc: Analytical cookies are used to understand how visitors interact with the website. These cookies help provide information on metrics such as the number of visitors, traffic source, etc.

notice.title: Here's your cookies settings
notice.info: In order to subscribe to our newsletter, you need to customize your cookies settings first.
notice.desc: Press Blinking Cookie, then "Customize" and Enable "Functional" cookie or you can "Accept all" settings.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.date: This Privacy Policy has been published on
privacyPolicy.sub: We understand the importance of protection of your personal data, therefore we process your personal data lawfully, transparently, and fairly, for the pre-determined purposes and only to the extent necessary to achieve those purposes. When we process your personal data, we make every effort to ensure that they are accurate, secure, confidential, properly stored and protected. When processing your personal data, we comply with the requirements of the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) (“GDPR”).

msg1.1: 1.1. This Privacy Policy (“Privacy Policy”) informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use and disclosure of data when you visit our website www.threecubes.gg (“Website”), contact us for recruiting purposes, use our services or enter into contract with us. The Privacy Policy applies to every person who visits the Website, as well as to any actions you may take on the Websites.
msg1.2: 1.2. Please read this Privacy Policy carefully to find out how we process your personal data, where we get them from and what your rights as a data subject are.
msg1.3: 1.3. The term "personal data" as used in this Privacy Policy means any information which could be used to identify you directly or indirectly.

msg2.1: 2.1. The Website is managed and administered by VšĮ Edukraftas (legal entity code 305465636, registered office address at V. Nagevičiaus g. 3, Vilnius, Lithuania, e-mail address info@tryskubai.lt).
msg2.2: 2.2. We are a controller of your personal data.

list.title3: 3. What personal data we process and for what purposes?

1.0: 3.1. We process your personal data for the following purposes:
3.1.1. to make and cary out service agreements with legal or natural persons.

1.title: Personal data categories
1.msg: First name, last name, individual activity certificate number, contact information, contents of correspondence, other details contained in the agreement

2.title: Legal basis for processing the personal data
2.msg: Processing is necessary for the performance of a contract (Article 6(1)(b) of GDPR) or processing is necessary for the legitimate interest to pursue activities (Article 6(1)(f) of GDPR).

3.title: Time limit for processing of the personal data
3.msg: Your personal data is processed for 10 (ten) years after the agreement expires.

4.title: We receive the personal data from

5.title: We provide or transfer the personal data to
5.msg: Third party service providers whose services we normally use for data storage, website hosting purposes and other technical services.

2.0: 3.1.2. to select candidate to fill vacant positions.

1.title: Personal data categories
1.msg: First name, last name, phone number, email address, CV; cover letter; other information related to your professional competence that you voluntarily provide when applying for a job position. We only process your personal data that is provided in the documents sent to us and that relates to your competence, skills and experience and that helps us to better assess your potential and career opportunities.

2.title: Legal basis for processing the personal data
2.msg: Your consent to the processing of personal data (Article 6(1)(a) of GDPR); and Our legitimate interest in selecting suitable candidates (Article 6(1)(f) of GDPR)

3.title: Time limit for processing of the personal data
3.msg: We will process your personal data only for as long as the selection of the candidate (usually 3-4 months) to which you have provided information about yourself is carried out. At the end of the selection phase and with your separate consent, we will process your data for another 1 (one) year so that during this period, if a suitable position appears according to your CV, we can offer you to participate in the selection or submit a job offer.

4.title: We receive the personal data from

5.title: We provide or transfer the personal data to
5.msg: Recruitment companies that assist us in recruiting candidates and provide us with services related to recruitment, candidate assessment and internal administration and third party service providers whose services we normally use for data storage, website hosting purposes and other technical services.

3.0: 3.1.3. to ensure the functionality of the Website, administer the Website, diagnose possible malfunctions of the Website, and perform statistical analyses in order to determine your needs in relation to certain functions and to analyse how and where to make the most efficient use of the available resources:

1.title: Personal data categories
1.msg: Internet Protocol (IP) address; type of web browser used; number of visits; view pages of the website; time spent on the Website; online source from which the person came; information about the device you are using; language; country; internet provider, etc.

2.title: Legal basis for processing the personal data
2.msg: Your consent to the processing of personal data (Article 6(1)(a) of GDPR)

3.title: Time limit for processing of the personal data
3.msg: Personal data is processed for as long as your consent is valid, but no longer than 2 (two) years

4.title: We receive the personal data from

5.title: We provide or transfer the personal data to
5.msg: Third party service providers whose services we normally use for data storage, website hosting purposes and other technical services.

4.0: 3.1.4. to manage and administer our social media accounts ( LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Discord):

1.title: Personal data categories
1.msg: Name of the social network account; personal photo; personal reactions to the content we generate (likes, comments, shares)

2.title: Legal basis for processing the personal data
2.msg: Your consent to the processing of personal data (Article 6(1)(a) of GDPR)

3.title: Time limit for processing of the personal data
3.msg: Personal data is processed for as long as our or your social networking account is valid, unless you express your wish to delete the data contained in our social networking accounts before

4.title: We receive the personal data from

5.title: We provide or transfer the personal data to
5.msg: We are joint controllers of your personal data together with social network operators

5.0: 3.1.5. to send You direct marketing messages (sending newsletters, promotions, surveys and other marketing offers and news):

2.title: Legal basis for processing the personal data
2.msg: Your consent to the processing of personal data (Article 6(1)(a) of GDPR).

3.title: Time limit for processing of the personal data
3.msg: Personal data shall be processed for as long as the Data Subject's consent is valid, but not longer than 2 years.

4.title: We receive the personal data from

5.title: We provide or transfer the personal data to
5.msg: IT, server service providers; our service providers who provide marketing services;.

msg3.2: 3.2. We may also use the information we collect in aggregate or otherwise anonymized form, i.e. the information that does not identify you or any specific person. We may use this general data for research, development, marketing, analytics.
msg3.3: 3.3. We do not collect or process your specific categories of personal data revealing your racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs or trade union membership, as well as health data or data about your sexual life and sexual orientation. Therefore, please do not provide this personal data to us by e-mail, telephone or in any other way.

list.title4: 4. To whom do we provide your personal data?

msg4.1: 4.1. We guarantee that your personal data will not be sold, provided or otherwise transferred to third parties without a legitimate basis, as well as used for purposes other than those for which they were collected. We will not transfer your personal data in any way other than in accordance with this Privacy Policy or applicable law. However, we reserve the right to provide information about you if we were required to do so by law or if required to do so by law enforcement authorities or prosecuting authorities or seeking to protect our rights or interests (including the case when your personal data is transferred to others for debt recovery purposes).
msg4.2: 4.2. We may transfer your personal data to companies that help us operate, i.e. data processors. From such data processors, we require that your data be processed only in accordance with the instructions given by us and the applicable data protection legislation. We enter into agreements with these data processors that oblige the parties to adhere strictly to the personal data protection requirements.

3.0: 4.3. We may disclose the personal data we collect about you to the following third parties:
3.b: b) third party service providers whose services we normally use for data storage, website hosting purposes and other technical services or service providers as debt administration/collection companies or companies providing archiving services, also to legal/marketing service providers. In some cases, your data may be transferred to the third countries where other personal data protection regulations may apply. We have taken appropriate safeguards (e.g. Standart Contractual Clauses) to ensure that your personal data remains protected, and we require that our third-party service providers and partners also have appropriate safeguards in place;
3.c: c) law enforcement authorities, bodies and/or other recipients to whom the data must be communicated in accordance with legal requirements.

list.title5: 5. How and where do we store your personal data?

msg5.1: 5.1. The personal data we collect from you will be located within the European Economic Area (EEA) but may be transferred or stored outside the EEA. When transferring your personal data outside the EEA, we will take all necessary steps to ensure that your personal data is processed securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy, we will do this by ensuring necessary measures and safeguards, including Standart Contractual Clauses.
msg5.2: 5.2. The security of your information is important to us. We have a team dedicated to protecting your information and have put in place physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards. These measures include limiting access, using encryption, testing for vulnerabilities, advanced malware detection, employing pseudonymization and anonymization techniques, and more.
msg5.3: 5.3. Unfortunately, the transmission of information over the internet is not completely secure. Although we make every effort to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee the complete security of it. Therefore, please be informed that you provide us with information at your own risk.
msg5.4: 5.4. Should unlikely circumstances arise and we become aware of a personal data breach that could seriously jeopardize your rights or freedoms, we will notify you immediately as soon as we become aware of it and determine what information has been accessed.

list.title6: 6. How long do we store personal data?

msg6.1: 6.1. We store your personal data for no longer than required by the purposes of the processing or as required by law if it provides a longer storage period. Section 3 of the Privacy Policy specifies the terms of storage of your personal data separately for each purpose of use of personal data.

1.0: 7.1. When processing the personal data, we ensure your rights in accordance with the GDPR. As a personal data subject, you have the following rights:
1.a: a) to know (be informed) about the processing of your personal data;
1.b: b) to access your personal data that we process;
1.c: c) to request the correction or supplementation of incorrect, inaccurate, incomplete personal data;
1.d: d) to require the destruction of your personal data when they are no longer needed for the purposes for which they were collected;
1.e: e) to demand the destruction of personal data if they are processed unlawfully or if you withdraw your consent to the processing of personal data or do not give such consent, which is necessary;
1.f: f) to object to the processing of personal data or to withdraw prior consent;
1.g: g) to demand the suspension (other than storage) of your personal data processing in the event of a dispute or verification of the lawfulness of the processing, the accuracy of the data, as well as in cases when we no longer need your personal data but you do not want us to destroy them;
1.h: h) to require the submission, if technically possible, of your personal data collected with your consent or for the purposes of the performance of the agreement in an easy-to-read format or request their transfer to another controller.

msg7.2: 7.2. We will endeavor to guarantee the exercise of your rights as a personal data subject and to create all conditions for the effective exercise of these rights, but we reserve the right not to comply with your requirements when it is required by the relevant legal grounds. If we refuse to comply with your request, we will clearly state the grounds for such refusal.
msg7.3: 7.3. You can submit requests related to the exercise of your rights to us in person, by post or by electronic means using contact details stated in this Privacy Policy. Upon receipt of your request, we may ask you to provide proof of identity, as well as any additional information we require regarding your request.
msg7.4: 7.4. Upon receipt of your request, we will respond to you no later than within 30 calendar days from the receipt of your request and the date of submission of all documents required for the response. This period may be extended by two months where necessary, taking into account the complexity and number of the requests. We will inform you of any such extension within one month of receipt of the request, together with the reasons for the delay.
msg7.5: 7.5. If we refuse to comply with your request, we will clearly state the grounds and reasons for such refusal.
msg7.6: 7.6. If you do not agree with our actions or the response to your request, you may appeal against our actions and decisions to the competent public authority.

list.title8: 8. To whom can you make a complaint?

msg8.1: 8.1. If you wish to make a complaint about our processing of your personal data, please provide it in writing, providing as much information as possible, using the contact details indicated at the end of this Privacy Policy. We will immediately try to resolve any issues.
msg8.2: 8.2. If you consider that the collection and processing of personal information relating to you infringes the GDPR and yours rights, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the State Data Protection Inspectorate (www.vdai.lrv.lt) or a supervisory authority in another Member State of the European Union in which you have habitual residence or place of work (list of supervisory authorities is available here: https://edpb.europa.eu/about-edpb/about-edpb/members_lt#member-lt ), or to apply to the court. Although, above all, we seek to resolve all disputes with you promptly and amicably.

msg9.1: 9.1. Please be advised that the Website uses Cookies. You can find more information about Cookies in the “Cookie Policy”, which is an integral part of the Privacy Policy.

list.title10: 10. How will we change this Privacy Policy?

msg10.1: 10.1. We will continue to update our policies and practices as needed. We will notify you of any changes to our Privacy Policy by posting any changes here. If we do, you'll see that the date at the top of this Privacy Policy has changed.

cookiesPolicy.title: Cookies Policy
cookiesPolicy.date: This Cookie Policy has been published on
cookiesPolicy.sub: Cookie Policy (hereinafter the “Cookie Policy”) of the Website www.threecubes.gg (hereinafter the “Website”) managed and administered by VšĮ Edukraftas (legal entity code 305465636, registered office address at V. Nagevičiaus g. 3, Vilnius, Lithuania, e-mail address info@tryskubai.lt) (hereinafter “We”) explains what cookies are and how they are processed.

msg1.1: 1.1. Cookies are small text files that are sent to and temporarily stored on the device of each person visiting the Website from which the Website is accessed.
msg1.2: 1.2. The information collected by cookies on the Website helps to identify the visitor of the Website, save the history of the Website visited and adapt the content accordingly. The information collected by cookies allows Us to ensure your ability to browse more conveniently, provide you with attractive offers and learn more about the behavior of users of the Website, analyze trends and improve the Website, personal service and services provided by Us.

msg2.1: 2.1. By visiting the Website, you can express your consent by your active actions if you want to use cookies. If you do not give your consent to the use of cookies, cookies that are not of a technical nature will not be stored on your device.
msg2.2: 2.2. Please be informed that you can also manage and/or delete cookies according to your preferences. You can choose which cookies you want to accept and which you want to reject in your browser settings (Internet Explorer, Safari, Firefox, Chrome, etc.). You can delete any cookies that are already on your device, and most browsers can be set to prevent cookies from being stored. The location of these settings depends on the browser you are using.

3.0: 2.3. Please note that in most browsers it is possible to:
3.1: check what cookies are stored and delete individual cookies;
3.4: block the sending of all cookies;
3.5: delete all cookies when You close Your browser.

msg2.4: 2.4. You can withdraw your consent to the use of cookies at any time by changing your settings and deleting the cookies you have saved. If you choose to delete cookies, please note that any options you have set will also be removed and the Website may not function or function properly. For these reasons, we do not recommend that you disable cookies when using the Website.
msg2.5: 2.5. To learn more about cookies and how to manage or remove them, you can visit: www.allaboutcookies.org.

list.title3: 3. What kind of cookies are used on the website?

1.0: 3.1. We use technical, analytical and commercial cookies on this Website:

1.0msg: Technical cookies: help to display the Website to you and ensure its functionality. These technical cookies are essential for the proper functioning of the Website.

msg3.1: Registers a unique ID for tracking user live chat state and history for chat continuity.
msg3.2: Checks whether the user has seen the newsletter dialog. Provides information to the mailerlite API on which dialog to show to the user.

2.0msg: Analytical cookies helps us to understand how our visitors use the Website. Helps you to optimise and improve your Website, understand the effectiveness of your advertising and communications.

msg3.1: Registers a unique ID that is used to generate statistical data on how the visitor uses the website.
msg3.2: Used by Google Analytics to collect data on the number of times a user has visited the Website as well as dates for the first and most recent visit

1.3:
3.1.3. Commercial cookies 
 Commercial cookies: Our and third-party cookies are used to serve personalised advertising on Our and third-party websites based on your browsing behaviour, such as the services you have searched for and downloaded. 

 We would like to inform you that the Google Analytics tool is provided by Google Inc. and therefore it also has access to the statistics collected by this tool. Google Inc. is committed to the protection and privacy of personal data. You can learn more about the processing of data by Google Inc. by clicking on the following link: https://business.safety.google/adsprocessorterms/.

list.title4: 4. To whom is the data collected by cookies transmitted?

msg4.1: The data collected through cookies may be transferred to Our authorised data processors who provide Us with, for example, Website hosting services and other services. Please be informed that we have concluded data processing agreements with each processor and ensure that each processor implements an adequate level of technical and organisational security measures for the protection of personal data.

list.title5: 5. What are your rights and how can you implement them?

1.0: As a data subject, you have the following rights:
1.1: The right to be informed about our processing of personal data.
1.2: The right to have access to your personal data processed by us.
1.3: The right to request rectification of your personal data processed by us.
1.5: The right to restriction of data processing.
1.6: The right to object to the processing of data.
1.7: Right to your personal data portability.
1.8: The right to submit a complaint to the State Data Protection Inspectorate.

msg5.2:
To exercise your rights, you can contact us at the following contact email address: info@tryskubai.lt
More detailed information about the procedure and time limits for exercising your rights is set out in our “Privacy Policy”.

list.title6: 6. Your right to lodge a complaint

msg6.1: If you believe that your rights have been violated, you can always contact us by email at info@tryskubai.lt and/or file a complaint with the State Data Protection Inspectorate (L. Sapiegos g. 17, LT-10312 Vilnius, by e-mail ada@ada.lt).
